Text: Looks like I was right.
Is that an ancient fighting technique...?
Alexia ignores Nelson's pompous remark.

From the outset, the duel had been a one-sided
offensive on Aurora's part.

The way the crimson lines dance about with such
terrific speed has Alexia in shock.
They are completely unlike any existing weapon.

They change shape freely, and Aurora controls them
as if they are an extension of her body.

If she spread the spears out over a larger area, she
could likely take down entire units of foes at once.

Get caught up trying to fight that with a sword, and
you'd be dead before you even started.

This is how the ancients fought. Alexia has to admit
that she wouldn't stand a chance.

Shadow is more persistent than I had given him credit
for, but it is plain to see that he is completely
outmatched…

No. Alexia disagrees with Nelson's statement in her
mind.

It may seem as if Shadow is at a disadvantage in the
face of Aurora's onslaught, but he has yet to make a
move of his own.
He is simply getting a feel for her offense.

Aurora is indeed strong. The proof of that is her
ability to fight on equal footing with Shadow.

But...those red spears of hers haven't so much as
even touched him.
The spears haven't connected even once.
Hmm...?
...Isn't that right, Princess Alexia?
Yes, you're right. That woman is powerful.

No ordinary dark knight could hope to fend off
attacks like hers.
But Shadow is merely observing her for now.
Not even a swarm of mosquitoes can fell a lion.

There are more than a thousand spears now, but
Shadow sweeps them away with a single strike.

The red spears grow to the thickness of logs, then
strike again from all sides.

Possessed of a strength that could indeed slay lions,
they roar at Shadow and hound him incessantly, at
times dividing further, sometimes biting at him.
But none of the attempts ever strike him.

On the contrary, with each attempt Shadow's dodging
becomes more and more refined.

Once he realized the minimum amount of movement
needed, he reduces it even further for the next attack.

What had seemed to Alexia like the pinnacle of
offense and defense keeps reaching new and
further heights with each passing moment.
And then...

the silence is broken when log-like spears burst
forth from the ground in unison.
There are too many of them to count.

Whenever I evade the thick spikes, they twist like
tentacles and continue the chase.

They thrust like spears, weaving around the area like
thread and biting at me like jaws.

This is how she likes to fight—making sport of her
foes with tendrils she can move as she pleases.

I merely observe, watching her tentacles at work and
optimizing my responses.

I pare down the movement in each dodge, full steps to
half steps, two moves to one.

Though you can't win by just evading. Evasion is
needed to lead to counterattacks.

And the less movement needed to dodge...the faster
counterattacks can come...
until evasions and counterattacks coincide.
(This is wonderful, my violet-eyed beauty.)
(I haven't had a real conversation in a long time.)

(That's why I'm so very happy to speak with you,
Violet.)

Violet smiles gracefully, and we stare at each other
yet again for a moment.

(The better our ability to converse, the less dialogue
it takes to get a reading on each other's strength.
You also kinda get a feel for the other's situation.)
(And that's exactly why I know.)

(I know how this fight is gonna end. Violet probably
does too.)
(Sorry.)
With a thud, Shadow kicks off from a spear.
And with that—
the duel is over in a flash.
Shadow slips in close to Aurora.
Aurora smiles.
Too bad.

Before anyone can blink, a spray of blood fills
the air.
I wanted to fight you...
at your full strength.
The defeated Aurora crumbles apart...
and fades away as little glimmers of light.
Then, with a whip of his coat, Shadow is gone, too.

Quiet returnes to the arena as if the whole battle
had been a dream.
He won?
He did...

The conclusion had been effortless and abrupt, like a
lion snapping a lamb's neck.

No one can tell what Shadow had done or what sort
of exchange had unfolded.
That's why it feels so unsatisfying.
Absurd...! Aurora...lost?
But she was pressing the attack the entire time!
Nelson is outraged.
Suddenly the earth begins to rumble.
What the...?!
Cracks erupt in the dome..
What's going on?
...And it shatters with a deafening crash.
What the...?!
What the...?!
A crest hangs in the air before Alexia.
The crest abruptly transforms…
engulfing the arena in darkness.

Alpha and Delta watch these events unfold from a
rooftop.
The Sanctuary answered him...
Alpha speaks in a soft whisper.
Shadow, could it be...

...A giant set of doors appear in the center of the
stadium.
